text: Carminatia recondita is a Mesoamerican species of annual plants in the daisy family. Carminatia recondita is an annual herb with opposite leaves. Flower heads are borne in a spiked inflorescence, each head with about 11 greenish disc florets but no ray florets.McVaugh, Rogers 1972. Contributions from the University of Michigan Herbarium 9(4): 384–385 Carminatia recondita is found in Guatemala, El Salvador, Chiapas, Colima, Guerrero, Oaxaca, Jalisco, México State, Michoacán, Morelos, Nayarit, Veracruz, Sinaloa, and San Luis Potosí.Turner, B. L. 1997. The Comps of Mexico: A systematic account of the family Asteraceae, vol. 1 – Eupatorieae. Phytologia Memoirs. 11: i–iv, 1–272 == References == ==External links== *Photo of herbarium specimen collected in Sinaloa *Photo of herbarium specimen collected in Guatemala Category:Eupatorieae Category:Plants described in 1972 Category:Flora of Central America Category:Flora of Mexico
